court: -1- IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY ORDINARY ORIGINAL CIVIL JURISDICTION M/s.Bharmal Thread Works. .. .. Petitioner v/s. The Municipal Corporation of Gr. Bombay & ors. .. .. Respondents And Rizvi Estates and Hotels P.Ltd. .. Applicant With M/s.Hari Thread Works. .. .. Petitioners v/s. The Municipal Corporation of Gr. Bombay & ors. .. .. Respondents With M/s.Laxmi Thread Works .. .. Petitioners v/s. The Municipal Corporation of Gr.Bombay & ors. .. .. Respondents Mr.P.M.Palshikar with Miss Trupti Puranik for B.M.C. Mr.M.J. Shetty for Respondent No.7 & 8. ------ P.C. : P.C. : P.C. : 1. The representatives of all three Petitioners are present. -2- 2. All parties state that the order dated 19.1.2007 is a common order passed in all the above three Writ Petitions. The title of the order be changed accordingly. 3. Respondent Nos.1 to 6 are the Bombay Municipal Corporation and its officers, respectively. Only Respondent Nos.7 and/or 8, who are the builders, are required to execute the sale-deed in favour of the Petitioners in the above three Petitions. Hence, in the third line of paragraph 1 of the order dated 19.1.2007 "Nos.7 and 8" shall be added after the word "respondents".

All parties state that the order dated 19.1.2007 is a common order passed in all the above three Writ Petitions. The title of the order be changed accordingly. 3. Respondent Nos.1 to 6 are the Bombay Municipal Corporation and its officers, respectively. Only Respondent Nos.7 and/or 8, who are the builders, are required to execute the sale-deed in favour of the Petitioners in the above three Petitions. reasoning: All fallbacks failed or not confident.
